result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L Appleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew L Appleton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew L Appleton was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: with credit for 8 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $208.41 to Jacqueline G. Restitution to be paid FIRST before costs, fees and surcharges. Restitution to be paid joint and several with case 15CF403.

Pay all costs, fees, surcharges, and restitution during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. If revoked, court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds/wages.
Defendant to enter into a payment plan with the probation agent.
Participate in educational or vocational programming once medically cleared.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.
No contact with the victim or the co-defendant Roman Lovelace.

Participate in a cognitive thinking class.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew L Appleton

records.addlTxt: Judgment was satisfied and collected by DOC

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (20 pages) commencing DECEMBER 16, 2015 received and filed.
1/29/16 restitution notice mailed to victim.

Defendant Matthew L Appleton in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defendant previously in court but left due to a medical emergency. Court ordered this matter be adjourned pending the defendant's recovery.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Letter from Children's Hospital of Wisconsin on behalf of the defendant received and filed.

Attorney Victor E Plantinga in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing. Defense advises the court that the defendant has been admitted to the hosptial and unable to attend today's proceedings. Defense counsel requests an adjournment. State has no objection. Court grants adjournment. Court will continue the warrant previously imposed but stayed by Judge Rothstein on 8/27/2015. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victor E Plantinga in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Letter from Children's Hospital received and filed. Defendant was in the gallery but left before the case was called due to a medical emergency. Court issued but STAYED a warrant until the next court date. Court granted defense request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victor E Plantinga in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel advised the Court that his client is now back in the hospital and is awaiting surgery.  Defense counsel's request for adjournment was granted.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to Judge Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered bench warrant stayed to the next court date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status Update from Justice Point, received and filed.

Attorney Victor E Plantinga in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel, as well as Justice Point and the State advised the Court that defendant remains in the hospital as a result of being a victim of a shooting.  Parties request a stayed bench warrant.  Court granted joint request and ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 7/29/15 before Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
/from Attorney Plantinga, received and filed.
Received and filed.

Defendant Matthew L Appleton in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  Sara Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   All terms of bail remain the same.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.

AS TO COUNT 2:
On motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 dismissed.  

Parties stiputated to restitution in the amount of $208.41.
Court advised defendant to go to Justice Point following today's proceeding to notify them of next hearing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Report received and filed.

Defendant Matthew L Appleton in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  James W. Frisch appeared on behalf of Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report received and filed.

Defendant Matthew L Appleton in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date; new disc of discovery was sent for defense counsel's review.  Court granted request for adjournment and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Matthew L Appleton in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another scheduling date; State still awaiting disc from MPD on defendant's statement.  Court allowed one more scheduling date. Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
/to Substitute Attorneys, signed and filed.  Attorney Plantinga is now the attorney of record.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Matthew L Appleton in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of Sara Schroeder for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Plantinga has been retained by defendant; Attorney Epps had previously noted the Court of same.  Defense counsel did receive discovery and an offer letter; requested another scheduling date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Epps advised the court that defendant has retained private counsel.

Defendant Matthew L Appleton in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Epps in another court; contacted this court to select a date to coincide with co-defendant's case.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and granted request for another date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Defendant was provided with his attorney's telephone number with instructions to contact him as well as provided with an orange date slip.  File retained in court.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Matthew L Appleton in court with attorney Alex Lockwood for Louis Edward Epps.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Gasser-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/3/15.

15RM003115  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-25-2015
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: J. CARTER, T. CARTER, A.CATHEY OR THEIR RESIDENCE. CO-DEF: ROMAN LOVELACE.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew L Appleton in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  Defendant Matthew L Appleton in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
